name: kinetoscope
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an object containing a very small hole through which a person watched a film in the early days of film: The kinetoscope was a forerunner of the modern film projector.
More examplesFewer examplesOnly one person at a time could view a film through a kinetoscope.In 1894, kinetoscopes were put in amusement arcades and hotel lobbies.Thomas Edison developed the kinetoscope, a wooden case with a peephole for viewing.Sam Warner discovered the Edison Kinetoscope and began working as a projectionist.
